metadata.title: CVE-2020-27763 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/resize.c. An attacker whosubmits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could triggerundefined behavior in the form of math division by zero. This would mostlikely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentiallycause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affectsImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm11').
